docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Moil Meeting is an innovative video conferencing solution that leverages MoilApp's high-quality fisheye image processing technology. Built on the Moildev SDK, the system specializes in processing fisheye imagery to produce panoramic and wide-angle (360°) views.

Using a single fisheye camera, Moil Meeting provides comprehensive room coverage and dynamic participant tracking capabilities, delivering a simpler, more flexible, and cost-effective alternative to traditional video conferencing systems.

docs.title: Definition and Overview
docs.text: This section provides essential information about Moil Meeting and the technology behind it.

docs.title: What is the Moil Meeting
docs.text: Moil Meeting is a powerful video conferencing application that leverages advanced fisheye lens technology to provide immersive and comprehensive meeting experiences.

docs.title: Key Points
docs.text:
• Desktop Application — Moil Meeting runs as a standalone desktop application on Windows, Linux, and macOS
  • Fisheye Technology — Uses fisheye camera lenses to capture wide-angle views
  • Multi-mode Support — Offers various viewing modes for different meeting scenarios
  • Recording Capability — Full meeting recording with multiple format options

docs.title: Use Cases
docs.text: Scenario Description Video Conferences Host or join video meetings with comprehensive room coverage Presentations Focus on presenters while capturing audience Discussions Multi-view display for group discussions Monitoring Room surveillance and event coverage

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text: Moil Meeting comes with a comprehensive set of features designed for modern video conferencing needs.

docs.title: Core Features
docs.text:
Multi-Mode Viewing Switch between different viewing modes to match your meeting needs: - Original Mode for raw camera output - Discussion Mode for group meetings - Global Mode for panoramic views - Patrol Mode for automated scanning - Presentation Mode for focused presentations

Video Recording Record your meetings with flexible options: - Multiple output formats (MP4, AVI) - Configurable quality settings - Audio recording support

Camera Control Full control over your fisheye camera: - Start/Stop camera - Resolution settings - Brightness, contrast, and exposure adjustments

User Interface A clean, intuitive interface with: - Easy mode selection - Configuration panel - Status bar with real-time information - Cross-platform support

docs.title: What is Fisheye Lens Technology?
docs.text: Fisheye lens technology is a specialized optical system that provides ultra-wide-angle views, typically covering 180 degrees or more.

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text: A fisheye lens captures a hemispherical field of view by using a curved lens element that bends light from a wide area onto the camera sensor. This creates the characteristic "fisheye" distortion in the resulting image.

docs.title: Advantages of Fisheye Technology
docs.text: Advantage Description Wide Coverage Single camera covers entire room No Moving Parts No need for mechanical pan/tilt Complete Overview See all participants simultaneously Cost Effective One fisheye camera replaces multiple standard cameras

docs.title: Dewarping
docs.text:
The Moil Meeting application uses advanced dewarping algorithms to transform the distorted fisheye image into natural-looking perspectives:

  • Panoramic Views — Create wide, undistorted panoramic images
  • Perspective Correction — Extract natural views from specific areas
  • Multi-view Generation — Create multiple corrected views simultaneously

docs.title: Applications in Video Conferencing
docs.text:
Fisheye technology enables:

  1. Complete Room Coverage — Capture all participants with a single camera
  2. Flexible Views — Extract different views from the same video source
  3. No Blind Spots — Ensure no area is missed during meetings
  4. Dynamic Focus — Switch focus between different areas without moving the camera

For detailed information about using these features, please refer to the Modes and Operations sections.

docs.title: Moil Meeting Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide provides comprehensive instructions for installing Moil Meeting on your system.

docs.title: Operating System Requirements
docs.text: Before installing Moil Meeting, ensure your system meets the following requirements.

docs.title: Supported Operating Systems
docs.text: Operating System Version Architecture Windows 10, 11 64-bit Linux Ubuntu 20.04+, Debian 11+ 64-bit macOS 11 (Big Sur) or later Intel / Apple Silicon

docs.title: Hardware Requirements
docs.text:
Minimum Requirements:

  • CPU: Intel Core i5 or AMD Ryzen 5 (or equivalent)
  • RAM: 8 GB
  • Storage: 500 MB free space
  • GPU: Integrated graphics with OpenGL 3.3 support
  • USB: USB 2.0 port for camera connection

Recommended Requirements:

  • CPU: Intel Core i7 or AMD Ryzen 7 (or equivalent)
  • RAM: 16 GB
  • Storage: 1 GB free space
  • GPU: Dedicated GPU with OpenGL 4.5 support
  • USB: USB 3.0 port for optimal camera performance

docs.title: Camera Requirements
docs.text:
• Compatible fisheye camera
  • Proper camera drivers installed
  • USB connection (USB 3.0 recommended for best performance)

docs.title: User Installation Guide
docs.text: Follow these steps to install Moil Meeting on your system.

docs.title: Windows Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the Installer

  2. Download the latest Moil Meeting installer (.exe) from the official website

  3. Run the Installer

  4. Double-click the downloaded file
  5. Accept the license agreement
  6. Choose installation location

  7. Click "Install"

  8. Complete Setup

  9. Wait for installation to complete
  10. Optionally create desktop shortcut

  11. Click "Finish"

  12. Launch Application

  13. Open Moil Meeting from Start Menu or desktop shortcut

docs.title: Linux Installation
docs.text:
Using APT (Debian/Ubuntu):

# Add repository
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:moil/meeting

# Update package list
sudo apt update

# Install Moil Meeting
sudo apt install moil-meeting

Using AppImage:

# Download AppImage
wget https://releases.moil.io/meeting/latest/MoilMeeting.AppImage

# Make executable
chmod +x MoilMeeting.AppImage

# Run application
./MoilMeeting.AppImage

docs.title: macOS Installation
docs.text:
1. Download DMG File

  2. Download the latest Moil Meeting .dmg from the official website

  3. Mount and Install

  4. Double-click the DMG file

  5. Drag Moil Meeting to Applications folder

  6. First Launch

  7. Open from Applications folder
  8. Allow security permissions if prompted
  9. Grant camera access when requested

docs.title: Developer Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide is for developers who want to build Moil Meeting from source or contribute to development.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.9 or higher
  • Git
  • pip package manager
  • Virtual environment (recommended)

docs.title: Clone Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/perseverance-tech-tw/video-conference-using-fisheye.git
cd video-conference-using-fisheye

docs.title: Setup Virtual Environment
docs.text:
# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv

# Activate virtual environment
# On Linux/macOS:
source venv/bin/activate
# On Windows:
venv\Scripts\activate

docs.title: Install Dependencies
docs.text: pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Run Application
docs.text: python main.py

docs.title: Development Tools
docs.text:
Linting:

pip install flake8
flake8 src/

Testing:

pip install pytest
pytest tests/

docs.title: Building from Source
docs.text:
Create Executable:

pip install pyinstaller
pyinstaller --name MoilMeeting --windowed main.py

The built application will be in the dist/ directory.

For usage instructions after installation, refer to the Usage guide.

docs.title: Modes
docs.text: Moil Meeting offers multiple viewing modes to accommodate different meeting scenarios. Each mode transforms the fisheye camera image into optimized views.

docs.title: Original Mode
docs.text: Original Mode displays the raw fisheye camera image without any transformation or processing.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Original Mode is the default viewing mode that shows the unprocessed output from your fisheye camera. This mode is useful for:

  • Viewing the complete camera coverage
  • Calibrating camera settings
  • Troubleshooting image issues

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Select Original Mode from the mode selector
  3. The full fisheye image will be displayed

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Full Resolution — View the image at native camera resolution
  • No Processing — Raw image without dewarp processing
  • Complete Coverage — See the entire fisheye field of view

docs.title: When to Use Original Mode
docs.text: Scenario Recommended Camera calibration ✓ Testing camera connection ✓ Viewing complete coverage ✓ Active meetings ✗ (use other modes)

docs.title: Discussion Mode
docs.text: Discussion Mode is optimized for group discussions and meetings, providing multiple views of participants.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Discussion Mode automatically creates multiple dewarped views to capture all participants in a meeting scenario. This mode is ideal for:

  • Group meetings with multiple participants
  • Round table discussions
  • Collaborative sessions

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera and ensure all participants are visible
  2. Select Discussion Mode from the mode selector
  3. Multiple participant views will be displayed

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Multi-view Display — Shows multiple dewarped views simultaneously
  • Automatic Layout — Views are arranged for optimal visibility
  • Participant Focus — Each view focuses on different areas

docs.title: Configuration Options
docs.text: Setting Description Number of Views Adjust how many views are displayed View Layout Choose grid or other layouts View Size Adjust individual view sizes

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Camera Position — Center the camera for equal coverage
  2. Participant Arrangement — Arrange participants evenly around the camera
  3. Lighting — Ensure even lighting for all participants

docs.title: Global Mode
docs.text: Global Mode provides a dewarped wide-angle view of the entire room, ideal for getting an overview of the meeting space.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Global Mode transforms the fisheye image into a wide panoramic view that shows the entire room in a natural perspective. This mode is useful for:

  • Viewing the complete meeting room
  • Getting spatial awareness of participants
  • Overview monitoring

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Select Global Mode from the mode selector
  3. A dewarped panoramic view will be displayed

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Panoramic View — Wide-angle dewarped perspective
  • Complete Coverage — See the entire room at once
  • Natural Perspective — Corrected distortion for natural viewing

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Field of View Adjust the viewing angle Pan Horizontal rotation adjustment Tilt Vertical angle adjustment

docs.title: Patrol Mode
docs.text: Patrol Mode automatically scans around the room, providing automated coverage of the entire meeting space.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Patrol Mode automatically rotates the dewarped view around the room, ensuring all areas are periodically visible. This mode is ideal for:

  • Automated room monitoring
  • Capturing all participants over time
  • Hands-free operation

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Select Patrol Mode from the mode selector
  3. The view will automatically begin scanning

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Automatic Scanning — View rotates automatically
  • Configurable Speed — Adjust scanning speed
  • Configurable Range — Set patrol limits
  • Pause/Resume — Manually control patrol

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Patrol Speed How fast the view rotates Medium Patrol Range Degrees to cover 360° Pause Duration Time to pause at each position 2 seconds

docs.title: Presentation Mode
docs.text: Presentation Mode is designed for presentations, focusing on the presenter and optionally the presentation materials.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Presentation Mode provides an optimized view for presentation scenarios, typically focusing on:

  • The presenter's position
  • Presentation screen/materials
  • Both presenter and materials in split view

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Position the presenter in the designated area
  3. Select Presentation Mode from the mode selector
  4. The view will focus on the presenter area

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Presenter Focus — Automatic focus on presenter area
  • Split View Option — Show presenter and slides together
  • Zoom Control — Adjust zoom level on presenter
  • Area Selection — Define presenter location

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Presenter Area Define where the presenter stands Zoom Level Adjust magnification Split View Enable presenter + slides view Auto-tracking Follow presenter movement

docs.title: AI Tracking
docs.text: AI Tracking uses artificial intelligence to automatically track and follow participants during meetings.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: AI Tracking enhances the viewing experience by automatically detecting and following active speakers or moving participants.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Speaker Detection — Automatically identifies the active speaker
  • Auto-follow — Camera view follows the detected person
  • Multiple Tracking — Can track multiple participants
  • Smooth Transitions — Natural view transitions between speakers

docs.title: How to Enable
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Enable AI Tracking from the settings
  3. The system will begin tracking automatically

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Setting Description Sensitivity How quickly tracking responds Tracking Mode Speaker-based or motion-based Transition Speed How fast the view moves

For detailed operation instructions, refer to the Operations section.

Located on the side of the application, the control panel provides access to:

  • Mode selection
  • Recording options
  • Configuration settings

  • Recording status
  • Current mode
  • Frame rate information

docs.title: Application Modes
docs.text:
Moil Meeting supports multiple viewing modes:

Mode Description Original Raw fisheye image view Discussion Optimized for group discussions Global Wide-angle room view Patrol Automated room scanning Presentation Focus on presenter

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get started with Moil Meeting in just a few simple steps.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • Moil Meeting installed on your system
  • A compatible fisheye camera connected
  • Proper camera drivers installed

docs.title: Step 1: Launch the Application
docs.text: Start Moil Meeting from your applications menu or by running the executable.

docs.title: Step 2: Connect Your Camera
docs.text:
1. Ensure your fisheye camera is connected via USB
  2. Wait for the system to recognize the device
  3. The camera should appear in the device list

docs.title: Step 3: Start the Camera
docs.text:
1. Click the Start Camera button
  2. Wait for the camera feed to appear
  3. Verify the video is displaying correctly

docs.title: Step 4: Select a Mode
docs.text:
Choose from the available modes:

  • Original Mode — View the raw fisheye image
  • Discussion Mode — For group meetings
  • Global Mode — Wide-angle view
  • Patrol Mode — Automated scanning
  • Presentation Mode — Presenter focus

docs.title: Step 5: Start Recording (Optional)
docs.text:
If you want to record the meeting:

  1. Click the Start Recording button
  2. The recording indicator will appear
  3. Click Stop Recording when finished

docs.title: Start Camera and Stop Camera
docs.text: This guide covers how to start and stop the camera in Moil Meeting.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Ensure your fisheye camera is properly connected
  • Verify the camera is recognized by your system

docs.title: Steps to Start Camera
docs.text:
1. Open Moil Meeting — Launch the application
  2. Select Camera Source — Choose your camera from the dropdown menu
  3. Click Start Camera — Press the "Start Camera" button
  4. Wait for Initialization — The camera feed should appear within a few seconds

docs.title: Start Camera Button
docs.text:
The Start Camera button is located in the control panel. When clicked:

  • The button label changes to "Stop Camera"
  • The camera feed begins streaming
  • The status bar shows "Camera Active"

docs.title: Steps to Stop Camera
docs.text:
1. Click Stop Camera — Press the "Stop Camera" button
  2. Confirm Stop — The camera feed will stop immediately
  3. Status Update — The status bar shows "Camera Inactive"

docs.title: When to Stop the Camera
docs.text:
• When ending a meeting
  • When switching cameras
  • When troubleshooting camera issues

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Camera Not Starting: - Check USB connection - Verify camera drivers are installed - Restart the application - Try a different USB port

Camera Feed Is Black: - Ensure the camera lens cap is removed - Check lighting conditions - Verify camera settings in configuration panel

docs.title: Start Recording and Stop Recording
docs.text: This guide covers how to record meetings using Moil Meeting.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Camera must be active before recording
  • Sufficient disk space for the recording
  • Proper write permissions for the output directory

docs.title: Steps to Start Recording
docs.text:
1. Ensure Camera is Running — The camera must be started first
  2. Click Start Recording — Press the "Start Recording" button
  3. Recording Indicator — A red recording indicator will appear
  4. Monitor Status — The status bar shows recording time

docs.title: Recording Settings
docs.text:
Before starting a recording, you may want to configure:

  • Output directory
  • Video format
  • Quality settings
  • Audio options

docs.title: Steps to Stop Recording
docs.text:
1. Click Stop Recording — Press the "Stop Recording" button
  2. Wait for Processing — The video file will be finalized
  3. File Saved — A confirmation message shows the save location

docs.title: After Recording
docs.text:
• The recording is saved to your configured output directory
  • Default format is typically MP4 or AVI
  • Check the file to ensure recording was successful

docs.title: Recording Tips
docs.text:
1. Test Before Important Meetings — Always do a test recording first
  2. Check Disk Space — Ensure sufficient storage before long recordings
  3. Monitor Performance — Recording may impact system performance
  4. Use Quality Settings — Adjust quality based on your needs

docs.title: Release Notes
docs.text: Moil Meeting Desktop Application v2.0

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: We are excited to announce the official launch of Moil Meeting Desktop Application v2.0. This release brings a powerful set of core features designed to make online meetings, team communication, and collaboration easier than ever — all within a modern, lightweight interface.

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text:
All-in-one meeting platform — Video calls, chat, and file sharing in a single application.

User-friendly design — A clean, intuitive interface with simple navigation.

Cross-platform support — Available on Windows, Linux, and macOS.

Optimized performance — Lightweight, fast, and stable even on limited connections.

docs.title: What's New in 2.0
docs.text:
Video List Browse and manage the list of available videos in one organized view.

Right-Click Menu → Show Original Window Right-click on a video to open the original source window.

Dialog Open Source with Token Access open source content through a dedicated dialog with token-based authentication.

Camera Orientation Modes Three camera orientation modes: Upside, Front, and Downside for flexible viewing.

UI Scaling Adjust the user interface scale for better visual comfort across different screen sizes.

Video Playback Play videos directly within the application without the need for external tools.

docs.title: Improvements
docs.text:
Adjust Page Size Clearly Optimized page layout for better readability across various screen resolutions.

Consistent UI Unified design with clearer icons, colors, and navigation.

Improved Color Contrast Updated color scheme and contrast for improved accessibility and readability, especially in light and dark modes.
